qas.question: What is the largest police department of South Carolina?

answers.text: The City of Charleston Police Department

qas.question: How many reserve police officers do the Charleston Police Department have?
How many civilians serve on the Charleston Police Department?
Who is the current Chief of the Charleston Police Department?
What year did Reuben Greenberg retire as Chief of Charleston Police Department?

plausible_answers.text: The City of Charleston Police Department

qas.question: What is the smallest police department of South Carolina?
How many reserve police officers don't the Charleston Police Department have?
How many civilians don't serve on the Charleston Police Department?
Who is the former Chief of the Charleston Police Department?
What year did Reuben Greenberg unretire as Chief of Charleston Police Department?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The City of Charleston Police Department<b5_0/><a0_0/>, with a total of 452 sworn officers, <a2_0><b7_0>137<b7_0/><a2_0/> civilians, and <a1_0><b6_0>27<b6_0/><a1_0/> reserve police officers, is South Carolina's largest police department. Their procedures on cracking down on drug use and gang violence in the city are used as models to other cities to do the same.[citation needed] According to the final 2005 FBI Crime Reports, Charleston crime level is worse than the national average in almost every major category. <a3_0><b8_0>Greg Mullen<b8_0/><a3_0/>, the former Deputy Chief of the Virginia Beach, Virginia Police Department, serves as the current Chief of the Charleston Police Department. The former Charleston police chief was Reuben Greenberg, who resigned August 12, <a4_0><b9_0>2005<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Greenberg was credited with creating a polite police force that kept police brutality well in check, even as it developed a visible presence in community policing and a significant reduction in crime rates.
